hanzi-su-wiki:
職

Значения

Работа, профессия, должность

Мнемоника

Справа — распознавать вид оружия 戈 по звуку 音. Служба есть умение на слух 耳 хорошо распознавать приказания вышестоящих.

Варианты

职, 耺
purpleculture_pinyin:
zhí
office; duty
офис; долг

purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 职)
Pictophonetic: 戠 indicates the sound; 耳 (ear) conveys the meaning.

heisig_chinese_memo: Worst job post in history: quality checker at the kazoo factory. Imagine the toll on your ears!
heisig_constituent: post, ear, kazoo, sound, vase, stand up, sun, day, fiesta
heisig_story: The key word refers to one's occupation, or position of employment. Its elements: ear . . . kazoo.
koohiiStory1: Worst post in history: quality checker at the kazoo factory. Imagine the toll on your ears!
koohiiStory2: Buckingham Palace guards are famous for staying at their post no matter what, even if you blow a kazoo in their ear!
jp_example_words:
教職(きょうしょく): teaching certificate, the teaching profession
辞職(じしょく): resignation
職員(しょくいん): staff member, personnel
職務(しょくむ): professional duties
退職(たいしょく): retirement (from office)
役職(やくしょく): post, managerial position, official position
就職(しゅうしょく): finding employment, inauguration
職(しょく): employment
職業(しょくぎょう): occupation, business
職人(しょくにん): worker, mechanic, artisan, craftsman
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Reaching your ear is the sound of a drunkard who can’t find employment. You hear him before you see him because he’s behind some trash cans. Being a drunkard, he’s like, super wasted and just kind of rambling to himself, making strange sounds. No wonder he can’t find employment.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Hear the strange sounds this drunkard is making. Let his ramblings enter your ears and imagine what he could be trying to say.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Since this guy is such a pathetic drunkard, it comes as no shock (しょく) that he can’t find employment. If he did find employment, I would be filled with both shock and awe.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Actually you find out that he does have employment. He’s a garbage man. Feel the shock of making this shocking discovery. How can this drunkard possibly hold down his job like this?
Ru_Notes: Фонетик: 戠 (ショク、シキ、シ собирать, склеивать). Не путать: 織 (おる、ショク、シキ плести, ткать).
Ru_Radicals: 戈 (копьё), 日 (день), 立 (стоять), 耳 (ухо), 音 (звук)
Ru_trainchinese: zhí: (графема) работа, обязанность; должность; управлять
Kanshudo_mnemonic: you use your ear (耳) and your potter's clay (戠) to find a job
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: At many jobs bosses only want you to use your ears and shut your mouth.
humanum_full_description_en:
The original meaning of " job " is duty. The conscientious person is aware of the details, so Xu Shen explained that the word " job " is a subtle recognition. "Shuowen": "Job, remember the micro. From the ear, the sound." Duan Yucai's note: " Remember that you still know. It's a job to know the slightest."

The inscription may borrow " Fan " as " post ", which means that Zeng Ji has no shirt pot: "A career talent (in) the royal family", "Er Ya. "Explanation": "Position, Chang Ye" (see Wang Yunzhi, Hao Shihong). Also used as a person's name, it is the name of King Yan Guozhao.
humanum_short_description_en: " post " from " ear ", " Zhi " sound, the original meaning of duties, responsibilities.
humanum_full_description:
「職」的本義是職責，盡責者明察秋毫，故許慎解釋「職」字為識別精微，《說文》：「職，記微也。从耳，戠聲。」段玉裁注：「記猶識也。纖微必識是曰職。」

　　金文或借「馘」為「職」，表示經常，曾姬無卹壺：「職才(在)王室」，《爾雅．釋詁》：「職，常也」（參王蘊智、郝士宏）。又用作人名，是燕國昭王之名。
humanum_short_description: 「職」從「耳」，「戠」聲，本義是職務、職責。

①管理某種事務，分(fèn)內應做的事：職業。職務。職守。職權。天職。盡職。
②執行事務所處的一定地位：職工。職位。職員。職稱。以身殉職。
③舊時公文用語，下屬對上司的自稱：卑職。職當奉命。
④掌管：職掌。
⑤由於：職此而已。

「 職 」的本義是職責，盡責者明察秋毫，故許慎解釋「 職 」字為識別精微，《說文》：「職，記微也。从耳，戠聲。」段玉裁注：「記猶識也。纖微必識是曰職。」 金文或借「 馘 」為「 職 」，表示經常，曾姬無卹壺：「職才(在)王室」，《爾雅．釋詁》：「職，常也」（參王蘊智、郝士宏）。又用作人名，是燕國昭王之名。
The original meaning of " job" is duty. The conscientious person is aware of the details, so Xu Shen explained that the word " job" is a subtle recognition. "Shuowen": "Job, remember the micro. From the ear, the sound." Duan Yucai's note: " Remember that you still know. It's a job to know the slightest." The inscription may borrow " Fan" as " post", which means that Zeng Ji has no shirt pot: "A career talent (in) the royal family", "Er Ya. "Explanation": "Position, Chang Ye" (see Wang Yunzhi, Hao Shihong). Also used as a person's name, it is the name of King Yan Guozhao.

職字的基本解释

職
zhí
见“职”。

職字的汉语字典释义

[①]［zhí］
［《廣韻》之翼切，入職，章。］
亦作“聀1”。“职1”的繁体字。亦作“軄1”。
(1)职务；职业；职分；职责。
(2)职位。亦指任职的处所。
(3)主管；任职。
(4)尽职；称职。
(5)功能，效用。
(6)常，正常。谓正常的生活及常业。
(7)常，正常。谓理所当然；常道。
(8)应纳的赋税或贡物。
(9)旧时下属对上司的自称。
(10)犹惟，只。表示主要由于某种原因。
(11)助词。犹当，尚。
(12)通“幟”。旗帜。
(13)通“識”。认识；识别。
(14)姓。汉有职洪。
[②]［tè］
［《集韻》敵德切，入德，定。］
通“樴1”。亦作“聀2”。“职2”的繁体字。
小木桩。

職字的康熙字典解释

【未集中】【耳字部】　職； 康熙笔画：18； 页码：页970第04
【廣韻】之弋切【集韻】【韻會】質力切，?音織。【說文】記微也。【徐曰】國有六職，皆主記事之微也。【增韻】執掌也。【爾雅·釋詁】職，主也。【博雅】職，事也。【書·周官】六卿分職，各率其屬，以倡九牧。【周禮·天官·大宰】九曰閒民，無常職。【註】謂無事業者。【史記·張丞相傳】沛公以周昌爲職志。【註】職，主也。志，旗幟也。謂掌旗幟之官也。　又【爾雅·釋詁】職，常也。　又貢也。【左傳·襄二十八年】共其職貢。【淮南子·原道訓】海外賓伏，四夷納職。【註】職，貢也。　又專也。【詩·大雅】民之罔極，職涼善背。【註】專由小人，名爲直諒。而實善背也。　又【揚子·方言】憐職，?也。言相?憐者，吳越之閒謂之憐職。　又職職，多也。【莊子·至樂篇】萬物職職。　又姓。【姓譜】周禮有職方氏，後因官爲氏。【風俗通】漢山陽令職洪之後。又【集韻】敵德切，音特。杙也。周官有職人。戚兗讀。或作樴樲。　又【集韻】逸織切，音弋。義同。　又與幟同。【史記·叔孫通傳】於是皇帝輦出房，百官執職傳警。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［zhí］
["Guangyun" wing cut, entry, chapter. ]
Also known as "聀1". Traditional characters of "职1". Also known as "軄1".
(1) Position; Occupation; Position; Responsibilities.
(2) Position. Also refers to the place of employment.
(3) Supervisor; hold office.
(4) Due diligence; competent.
(5) Function and utility.
(6) Often, normal. It is called normal life and regular occupation.
(7) Often, normal. That is a matter of course;
(8) Taxes or tributes payable.
(9) In the old days, subordinates called themselves superiors.
(10) Still only, only. Indicates that it is mainly due to some reason.
(11) Particles. Judang, Shang.
(12) Pass "Zhang". banner.
(13) Through "knowledge". Recognize; identify.
(14) Last name. Han Youzhi Hong.
[②]［tè］
["Ji Yun" Enemy De Chi, enter De, Ding. ]
Same as "樴1". Also known as "聀2". Traditional characters of "职2".
Small wooden stakes.

zhí, tè
duty, profession; office, post
Radicals: 耳, 音, 戈  (ear, sound, drunkard)
Meaning Mnemonic
Reaching your ear is the sound of a drunkard who can’t find employment. You hear him before you see him because he’s behind some trash cans. Being a drunkard, he’s like, super wasted and just kind of rambling to himself, making strange sounds. No wonder he can’t find employment.
Hear the strange sounds this drunkard is making. Let his ramblings enter your ears and imagine what he could be trying to say.
Reading Mnemonic
Since this guy is such a pathetic drunkard, it comes as no shock (しょく) that he can’t find employment. If he did find employment, I would be filled with both shock and awe.
Actually you find out that he does have employment. He’s a garbage man. Feel the shock of making this shocking discovery. How can this drunkard possibly hold down his job like this?
